content: 10 min mini 10 min mini basket instructions baskets using your basket color cast on 14 sts leaving a 10 /25cm tail for the handle divide the stitches over 2 dpns 7 sts on both needle 1 & 2 and join to work in the round round 1 knit round 2 ssk k3 k2tog repeat 10 sts round 3-4 knit round 5 ssk k1 k2tog repeat 6 sts cut yarn draw through remaining 6 stitches pull tight and secure closing hole if needed finishing step 1 weave in cast off end trim excess carefully step 2 turn/flip your basket inside out step 3 using your cast on end make the handle and then knot it to the opposite side hide end inside of basket trim carefully finished measurements please note if you are making the basket for my knit height & width 1 / 2 5cm or desired size peg dolls thread the handle through the dolls arm before you knot it to the other side this will secure it approximate yardage in place 3 yards total this is a great scrappy project pattern support yarn have fun with your mini baskets for pattern support i used patons classic worsted because i like a firm simply pm me on ravelry fabric the color is brown mustard you have my permission to sell any baskets you make needles but please credit me as the designer thanks one set of double-pointed needles dpns in size us 2 2 75mm or desired size gauge optional 6 stitches and 6 row = 1 /2 5cm over stockinette construction these mini baskets are knit from the top down in the round on 2 dpns the handle is made by knotting the cast on end to its opposite side to get the lovely woven look without the pesky purl stitches simply turn your basket inside out abbreviations k = knit k2tog = knit 2 together 1 st decreased ssk = slip slip knit slip 2 stitches knit-wise one at a time to your right needle then return the now-turned stitches back to the left needle knit them both together through the back loop decreasing 1 copyright 2023 by natasha hanson all rights reserved st s = stitch es 1
